dayt_event.Rules:
Duration: 5 + 1 minutes including settings.

Instrumentation can be Indian or western.

Type: Percussion or Non - Percussion.

Criteria for Judgement: Shruthi, Swara, Laya, Tala, Raga and general impression.

Elimination round where each team will be given a M.C.Q.s,.A fixed number of teams with best performance will be selected.

The teams will be given a circuit, Participants should rig up the circuit. Teams with the lowest clock time will be advanced to the 3 rd round.

Third round is the Debugging Round: The teams are required to find the faults in the given circuit and get the output.

Further information about each round will be provided to the participants on the day of event.

Rules are subjected to change without prior notice.

The decision of the event coordinator is final.

Maximum of 2 participants per team.

No of participating teams per college is 3.

The teams with the maximum faults identified will be the winners.
dayt_event.OtherRules: This is an event which involves complex circuit analysis and skills to perform practically and execute using analog devices and components. As the name suggests the event requires knowledge about circuit making on the bread board along with the knowledge of basic analog components.

dayt_event.Rules:
Game version will be provided to the participants through share it by the organizing team.

4 make a team.

Tournament format: 4 Vs 4 : best two out of 3 matches.

Limited amount of time will be given to configure.

Further information will be announced before the start of each match.

Not more then 3 teams per college.

Participants: Minimum 3 Maximum 6.

Duration: 9+1 minutes including settings.

Instrumentation can be indian or western.

Type: Percussion or Non - Percussion.

Criteria for Judgement: Shruthi, Swara, Laya, Tala, Raga and general impression.

Building planes will be provided, chain, tapes and arrows which will be provided can only be used.

4 participants per teams.

Duration 2 hr 30 minutes.

Further guidelines will be provided on the spot.

No of participating team per college is restricted to three.

Duration: 2 Hours.

Topic will be giveng on the spot.

Painting can be done using oil/water/poster colors.

Participants should bring their own materials.

Judgement Criteria: Creativity, Color Combination, Neatness, Theme, Completion.

Duration: 1 Hours.

Participants are required to make a unified artistic image on a given topic/theme by sticking together pieces of paper of pictures.

Required material should be brought by participants (glue, cello tape, newspaper, magazines etc).

Two participants per team.

3 make a team.

Prelims will be conducted, if there are too many teams.

The event will go on for 2-3 hours.

The event orgamizers decision will be final and binding.
dayt_event.OtherRules: Using a series of clues participants have to find a hidden treasure.

dayt_event.Rules:
TOPIC :
Emerging Trends in Science & Technology

DESCRIPTION OF ROUNDS:

1) PRELIMS (Online Submission):


Each team has to submit online an abstract on the basis of which they will be shortlisted for  the presentation.

Topics could be on any existing technology or an upcoming one.

Word limit 300.

Last Date for online submissions:01 march 2018.

Submit at: cocurricular@sode-edu.in


2)FINALS (Presentation):

8 minutes will be given to each team for presentation.

Interjection from judges and students for 2 minutes at the end.


RULES:

* Maximum of two participants can present a paper.

* The paper should be in IEEE format and must not exceed 6 pages.

*  Two copies of the selected paper should be brought by the team on the day of event and should be submitted 30 minutes before the commencement of the event.

* Visual aids must be present.

*  Prizes and certifications will be provided to the winners.
dayt_event.OtherRules:
Last Date for online submissions :
1st March 2018.

Submit at: cocurricular@sode-edu.in

dayt_event.Rules:
Duration: 4 + 1 minutes (Including settings).

Costume: Should be decent.

Music should be submitted in a CD/Pen-drive in the morning to the organizers.

No hazardous stage props allowed.

Criteria for Judgement: Technique, Grace, Confidence, Expression, Stage Presence.

The contestants are contested against the opponents on stage. The number of rounds will be decided by the response gathered.

The contestants will have to speak on a topic for about 1 minute. The topics are to be decided by the JAM master.

Speaking for 10 seconds will be rewarded 1 point,+1 poing for valid objection, -1 point for invalid objection.
5 points to the contesting holding floor at the end of 1 minute.

Participants: Minimum 5, Maximum 10.

Duration: 5 + 2 minutes.

Type: Any pure form of western dances like Hip Hop, Jazz, Filmy, Freestyle etc.

Costume: Should be decent.

Music should be submitted in a CD/Pen-drive in the morning to the organizers.

 Props are allowed.

Criteria for Judgement: Team Work, Rapport Building, Synchronization, Stage Creations, Choreography, Costumes and Confidence.

TOPIC:  Structure related to civil engineering.

Team may consist of maximum 4 members.

Time given 3 hours

Basic materials will be given.(Thermocol, glue and blades)

Individual event.

No. of participants per college is restricted to 3.

Further information about each round will be provided to the participants on the day of the event.

The rules are subjected to change without prior notice.

The decision of the Event Manager will be final.



Guidelines :

Round 1 :
 It is an elimination round where each team will be given MCQâ€™s based on matlab and Simulink, control systems , digital signal processing only.

Round 2 :
 Writing a code for a given problem statement.

Round 3 :
Design a matlab or Simulink model for the given problem statement.

Participants: Minimum 10, Maximum 16.

Duration: 13 + 2 minutes.

Costume: Should be decent.

There should be atleast one solo act and one group act.

Music should be submitted in a CD/Pen-drive in the morning to the organizers.

Criteria for Judgement: Team Work, Stage Creations, Creativity, Costumes and Confidence.
